intro: Borbonia globosa, commonly known as the globular borbonia, is a flowering plant native to Madagascar. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its compact, rounded shape and clusters of small, white flowers. The plant has dark green, glossy leaves that are opposite in arrangement. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. Due to its unique appearance and limited distribution, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
